definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
tube/cylinder/to encase in sth cylindrical (such as hands in sleeves etc)

sentences.english: The torchlight swung across the little beach and out over the water, searching.
sentences.chinese: 手電筒的光在小海灘上掃過，而後照向水面搜索着。

sentences.english: He read the note in the dim torchlight.
sentences.chinese: 他藉着微弱的電筒光看了條。

sentences.english: Most flashlights work on two batteries.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的手電筒用兩節電池。

sentences.english: He flashed his light under and over sofas and beds until he came to the biggest bed of all.
sentences.chinese: 他舉起手電筒照了沙發上下和牀，直到最大的那張牀。

sentences.english: Suddenly somehody flashed an electric torch.
Hand her a flashlight so she can see the way.
sentences.chinese: 給她一把手電筒讓她看清道路。

sentences.english: No waking me up when you come in at night using your BlackBerry as a flashlight.
sentences.chinese: 別半夜進屋把黑莓手機當手電筒使把我弄醒。

sentences.english: Flashlights shot streaks of gleam up and down at the walls.
sentences.chinese: 手電筒射出一道道光束，在牆上晃動。

sentences.english: In the light from my torch nothing had any color.
sentences.chinese: 在手電筒的光線的照射下，所有東西都沒了聲色。

sentences.english: To save energy I kept the flashlight off.
sentences.chinese: 爲了省電我關了手電筒。

sentences.english: Having no flashlight, I marched very slowly under the dim moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 月光很暗，我又沒有電筒，因而走得很慢。

sentences.english: In the torchlight,he caught sight of a figure.
sentences.chinese: 藉着電筒光，他看見一個人。

sentences.english: The doctor is examining his pupil with a torch.
sentences.chinese: 醫生打着手電筒檢查他的瞳仁。

sentences.english: His two sons carry torches and stare at the flames.
sentences.chinese: 他兩名兒子則手持電筒，盯着火焰。

sentences.english: She cherishes a hope that she will be a singer some day.
sentences.chinese: 他們懷着希望將手電筒一開一關地打信號。

sentences.english: U. S. Marines play a game of "Risk" by flashlight in Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 美海軍陸戰隊在手電筒下玩着一款冒險遊戲，阿富汗。

definition: to break the door down and enter (idiom)
fully armed/armed to the teeth/fig. fully equipped
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
